firemon_api.core.app¶

class firemon_api.core.app.App(api: FiremonAPI)¶

Bases: object

Base class for Firemon Apps

get_api() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Return API specs from the dynamic documentation

name = None¶
request(use_domain: bool | None = False, filters: dict | None = None, key: str | None = None, url: str | None = None, headers: dict | None = None, cookies: dict | None = None, trailing_slash: bool = False) → Request¶

Easy button to test basic application api calls.

Example

Query the Security Manager device api

>>> json = fm.sm.request(key="device", use_domain=True).get()
set_api() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Attempt to auto create all api calls by reading the dynamic api endpoint make a best guess. User must be authorized to read api documentation to use this.

All auto created methods get setattr on exec for App.

class firemon_api.core.app.DynamicApi(dynamic_api: dict, session: Session, app_url: str)¶

Bases: object

Attempt to dynamically create all the APIs

Warning

Most of the names are not intuitive to what they do. Good luck and godspeed.

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
